info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:29PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Cochise County through 515 PM MST... At 429 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tombstone, or 10 miles northeast of Sierra Vista, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whetstone, Huachuca City, Tombstone, Fort Huachuca, Fairbank and Charleston. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 305 and 314, and between mile markers 325 and 327. Route 82 between mile markers 50 and 67. Route 90 between mile markers 301 and 315. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
